title: More refined logic is expected to handle disk sorting when there are border values for row numbers
OB: When attempting to sort 40000 rows of data on disk, if the program is configured to process only a subset of the data (less than 40000 rows), the current implementation exhibits the following behavior:
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Sort a dataset with 40000 rows on disk 
2. Configure the program to process only a subset of the data (less than 40000 rows) 
3. The program should: 
   a. Save the data as a temporary file 
   b. Load the temporary file into memory 
   c. Perform the sorting operation on the loaded data 
   d. Save the sorted data back to the temporary file
